title: Amid anti-trans bills targeting youth, Dwyane Wade takes a stand for his daughter
description: The father and sports legend has been outwardly supportive of his daughter Zaya as culture wars surrounding trans rights have continued to swell.

title: Bride killed and groom injured when driver slams into golf cart after wedding
description: Authorities said the driver was speeding and intoxicated. Three additional passengers traveling in the golf cart, including the groom, were taken to a local hospital in serious condition.

title: America has a loneliness epidemic. Here are 6 steps to address it
description: Lacking connection can increase the risk for premature death to levels comparable to smoking 15 cigarettes a day, according to a new advisory from the U.S. Surgeon General.

title: Record number of people arrested in an international fentanyl operation, DOJ says
description: The Department of Justice announced arrests in an international operation targeting fentanyl sales on the dark web that spanned the U.S., Europe and South America. Nearly 300 people were arrested.

title: They're trying to cure nodding syndrome. First they need to zero in on the cause
description: Nodding syndrome is a rare neurological condition that can result in head nodding and violent seizures. Some researchers think they know the cause, but questions remain.

title: Voter turnout for the 2022 midterm elections was the 2nd highest since 2000
description: Voter turnout for last year's elections was the second highest for a midterms since 2000, and close to half of voters cast ballots early or by mail, estimates from a Census Bureau survey show.

title: Australia will crack down on illegal vape sales in a bid to reduce teen use
description: Australian Health Minister Mark Butler said vaping had been sold to the public as a product meant to help smokers quit but instead spawned a new generation of nicotine users, particularly teens.

title: 'The Covenant of Water' tells the story of three generations in South India
description: Much will be written about Abraham Verghese's latest novel in the coming months and years; it's a literary feat that deserves to be lauded as much as those of the likes of Dickens and Eliot.

title: Police discover 7 bodies at the home of a sex offender on his scheduled court date
description: A search for two missing Oklahoma teenagers and a convicted sex offender ended within hours on Monday when police found seven bodies, including five teenagers, on a rural property.

title: Gene therapy for muscular dystrophy stirs hopes and controversy
description: The FDA is considering greenlighting the experimental treatment under its accelerated approvals program. Some critics point out the therapy isn't yet proven to work and may be costly.

title: This company adopted AI. Here's what happened to its human workers
description: A group of economists conducted one of the first empirical studies of "generative AI" at a real-world company. They found it had big effects.

title: A sudden dust storm in Illinois led to car crashes that killed 6 and injured dozens
description: Police said more than 70 vehicles were involved in the crashes that left parts of Interstate 55 closed and more than 35 people injured. Injuries ranged from minor to life-threatening.

title: Would you live next to co-workers for the right price? This company is betting yes
description: Businesses like Cook Medical in Indiana say the housing shortage makes it harder to recruit and keep middle-income workers. Now, more companies are building places for employees to rent or even buy.

title: Why viral reservoirs are a prime suspect for long COVID sleuths
description: Scientists are turning up more evidence that some people may harbor a viral reservoir in the wake of COVID-19. What could that tell us about long COVID?

title: Nearly a third of nurses nationwide say they are likely to leave the profession
description: Unions representing nurses say the findings from the latest AMN Healthcare survey are not a surprise. The nurses unions have long warned about problems facing the profession.

title: Partisan divide drives Senate hearing on Supreme Court ethics
description: Senators heard from witnesses, ranging from judicial ethics experts to a former attorney general in the George W. Bush administration, but used their questioning to reinforce their own arguments.

title: Japan's Kishida plans to visit Yoon in South Korea before G-7
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida says he wants to travel to South Korea to further strengthen ties between the two countries after President Yoon Suk Yeol's March visit to Tokyo.
